intro: Odontostephana floridana, commonly known as the Florida odontostephana, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in swampy areas. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in dense, rounded heads. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
